verses.verse: And the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068> was in the country<WH7704> of the Philistines<WH6430> seven<WH7651> months<WH2320>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> called<WH7121> for the priests<WH3548> and the diviners<WH7080>, saying<WH559>, What shall we do<WH6213> to the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>? tell<WH3045> us with which we shall send<WH7971> it to his place<WH4725>.

And they said<WH559>, If you send away<WH7971> the ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, send<WH7971> it not empty<WH7387>; but in any wise<WH7725> return<WH7725> him a trespass offering<WH817>: then you shall be healed<WH7495>, and it shall be known<WH3045> to you why his hand<WH3027> is not removed from you<WH5493>.

Then said<WH559> they<WH817>, What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return<WH7725> to him<WH559>? They answered, Five<WH2568> golden<WH2091> ulcers<WH2914>, and five<WH2568> golden<WH2091> mice<WH5909>, according to the number<WH4557> of the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430>: for one<WH259> plague<WH4046> was on you all<WH5633>, and on your lords.

Why you shall make<WH6213> images<WH6754> of your ulcers<WH2914>, and images<WH6754> of your mice<WH5909> that mar<WH7843> the land<WH776>; and you shall give<WH5414> glory<WH3519> unto the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>: perhaps he will lighten<WH7043> his hand<WH3027> from off you<WH430>, and from off your gods, and from off your land<WH776>.

Why then do you harden<WH3513> your hearts<WH3824>, as the Egyptians<WH4714> and Pharaoh<WH6547> hardened<WH3513> their hearts<WH3820>? when he had worked wonderfully<WH5953> among them<WH7971>, did they not let the people go, and they departed<WH3212>?

Now therefore make<WH6213> a<WH259> new<WH2319> cart<WH5699>, and take<WH3947> two<WH8147> milk<WH5763> cows<WH6510>, on which there has come<WH5927> no yoke<WH5923>, and tie<WH631> the cows<WH6510> to the cart<WH5699>, and bring<WH7725> their calves<WH1121> home<WH1004> from them<WH310>:

And take<WH3947> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>, and lay<WH5414> it upon the cart<WH5699>; and put<WH7760> the jewels<WH3627> of gold<WH2091>, which you return<WH7725> him for a trespass offering<WH817>, in a coffer<WH712> by the side<WH6654> there<WH7971>; and send it away, that it may go<WH1980>.

And see<WH7200>, if it goes up<WH5927> by the way<WH1870> of his own coast<WH1366> to Beth<WH1053>–shemesh, then he has done<WH6213> us this great<WH1419> evil<WH7451>: but if not<WH3045>, then we shall know that it is not his hand<WH3027> that struck<WH5060> us<WH4745>; it was a chance that happened to us<WH1961>.
And the men<WH582> did so<WH6213>; and took<WH3947> two<WH8147> milk<WH5763> cows<WH6510>, and tied<WH631> them to the cart<WH5699>, and shut up<WH3607> their calves<WH1121> at home<WH1004>:
And they laid<WH7760> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068> upon the cart<WH5699>, and the coffer<WH712> with the mice<WH5909> of gold<WH2091> and the images<WH6754> of their ulcers<WH2914>.

And the cows<WH6510> took the straight<WH3474> way<WH1870> to the way<WH1870> of Beth<WH1053>–shemesh, and went along<WH1980> the highway<WH4546>, lowing<WH1600> as they went<WH1980>, and turned not aside<WH5493> to the right hand<WH3225> or to the left<WH8040>; and the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430> went<WH1980> after<WH310> them unto the border<WH1366> of Beth<WH1053>–shemesh.

And they of Beth<WH1053>–shemesh were reaping<WH7114> their wheat<WH2406> harvest<WH7105> in the valley<WH6010>: and they lifted up<WH5375> their eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200> the ark<WH727>, and rejoiced<WH8055> to see it<WH7200>.

And the cart<WH5699> came<WH935> into the field<WH7704> of Joshua<WH3091>, a Beth<WH1030>–shemite, and stood<WH5975> there<WH1419>, where there was a great stone<WH68>: and they split<WH1234> the wood<WH6086> of the cart<WH5699>, and offered<WH5927> the cows<WH6510> a burnt offering<WH5930> unto the Lord<WH3068>.

And the Levites<WH3881> took down<WH3381> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>, and the coffer<WH712> that was with it<WH3627>, where the jewels of gold<WH2091> were<WH7760>, and put them on the great<WH1419> stone<WH68>: and the men<WH582> of Beth<WH1053>–shemesh offered<WH5927> burnt offerings<WH5930> and sacrificed<WH2076> sacrifices<WH2077> the same day<WH3117> unto the Lord<WH3068>.
And when the five<WH2568> lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430> had seen<WH7200> it<WH7725>, they returned to Ekron<WH6138> the same day<WH3117>.

And these are the golden<WH2091> ulcers<WH2914> which the Philistines<WH6430> returned<WH7725> for a trespass offering<WH817> unto the Lord<WH3068>; for Ashdod<WH795> one<WH259>, for Gaza<WH5804> one<WH259>, for Askelon<WH831> one<WH259>, for Gath<WH1661> one<WH259>, for Ekron<WH6138> one<WH259>;

And the golden<WH2091> mice<WH5909>, according to the number<WH4557> of all the cities<WH5892> of the Philistines<WH6430> belonging to the five<WH2568> lords<WH5633>, both of fenced<WH4013> cities<WH5892>, and of country<WH6521> villages<WH3724>, even unto the great<WH1419> stone of Abel<WH59>, whereon they set down<WH3240> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>: which stone remains unto this day<WH3117> in the field<WH7704> of Joshua<WH3091>, the Beth<WH1030>–shemite.

And he struck<WH5221> the men<WH376> of Beth<WH1053>–shemesh, because they had looked<WH7200> into the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>, even he struck<WH5221> of the people<WH5971> fifty<WH2572> thousand<WH505> and sixty and ten<WH7657> men<WH582>: and the people<WH5971> lamented<WH56>, because the Lord<WH3068> had struck<WH5221> many of the people<WH5971> with a great<WH1419> slaughter<WH4347>.
And the men<WH582> of Beth<WH1053>–shemesh said<WH559>, Who is able<WH3201> to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> this holy<WH6918> Lord<WH3068> God<WH430>? and to whom shall he go up from us<WH5927>?

And they sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to the inhabitants<WH3427> of Kirjath<WH7157>–jearim, saying<WH559>, The Philistines<WH6430> have brought again<WH7725> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>; come you down<WH3381>, and fetch it up to you<WH5927>.
